channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for PA

item.title: Report X-2024031018
item.description:
Report X-2024031018

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-27T15:12:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-18
  • City: EASTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE CAR DRIVER WENT TO DELIVER PACKAGE, FOUND CORROSIVE PACKAGE ON SHELF LEAKING, CHEMICAL REACTED TO METAL ON SHELF. ON ROAD SUPERVISOR AND RMP SENT TO DRIVERS LOCATION TO CLEAN UP SPILL AND BRING BACK TO 1809 HUB FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2024030314
item.description:
Report E-2024030314

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-27T15:12:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-12
  • City: MARCUS HOOK
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: QUALITY CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: WHILE ENTERING THE CONSIGNEE FACILITY THE DRIVER REPORTED HIS BRAKING ACTION RESULTED IN PRODUCT RELEASE FROM FRONT WASHOUT CAP. INVESTIGATION SHOWED LOOSE CAP VIBRATION RESULTED IN RELEASE OF SMALL AMOUNT OF MATERIAL. CAP TIGHTENED SPILL CLEANED AND DELIVERY COMPLETED WITHOUT ADDITIONAL INCIDENT.

item.title: Report X-2024030859
item.description:
Report X-2024030859

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-26T15:10:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-13
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment taken out of system due to 5- gallon plastic pail / drum wet and leaking upon inspection of contents 1 x 5-gallon plastic pail / drum of Zep industrial purple digresser had a loose cap allowing .25 gallons to release from container. no outer package was found. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: 1 x 5-gallon plastic pail / drum of Zep industrial purple digresser had a loose cap allowing .25 gallons to release from container. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2024030857
item.description:
Report X-2024030857

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-26T15:10:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-13
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found the damaged hazmat on the hazmat pallet in QA. Saw wet spots on the packaging. Grabbed my PPE to further inspect the damage. DescribePack: The cap on one bottle is broken, has a crack. It leaked when the box was not upright during transit. DurationRel: 25 and MitigateEffect: The packaging and the bottles were placed upright to prevent any more leaks.

item.title: Report X-2024030855
item.description:
Report X-2024030855

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-26T15:10:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-13
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: SHIPMENT TAKEN OUT OF SYSTEM FLOW DUE TO EXTERNAL CARTON WET AND LEAKING PACKAGE FOUND ON TRAILER NUMBER # 810976 ALREADY DAMGAED WET AND LEAKING UPON INSPECTION OF INNER CONTENT 1 X 1 GALLON METAL CAN OF CHEMTRONICS FLUX-OFF ROSIN HAD AN LOOSE CAP ALLOWING .25 GALLON TO RELEASE FROM CONTAINER PACKAGE HAD NO SLOTTED PARTITIONS , BAGS OR ABSORBENT WAS FOUND Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: 1 X 1 GALLON METAL CAN OF CHEMTRONICS FLUX-OFF ROSIN HAD AN LOOSE CAP ALLOWING .25 GALLON TO RELEASE FROM CONTAINER DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: LEAKING PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG LINED TOTE.

item.title: Report X-2024030765
item.description:
Report X-2024030765

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-10
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found the damaged hazmat in damaged area in QA. The box was wet from the bottom and one side of the body of the box. Opening the box and all 4 bottes were upside down, even though the package was upright with the orientation arrows. DescribePack: The cap was loose on one of the bottle. DurationRel: 19 and MitigateEffect: Whoever brought the damaged hazmat to QA, thought they had it up right with the orientation arrows but the bottles were packed upside down.

Report X-2024030955

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found the damaged hazmat in a red hazardous material bin on the hazmat pallet in QA. Grabbed my PPE to inspect the damage. DescribePack: There is a crack on the bottom of both plastic pails. Leaked during transit. DurationRel: 35 and MitigateEffect: Turned the pails upside down to prevent any more leakage.

item.title: Report X-2024030679
item.description:
Report X-2024030679

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-19
  • City: CARLISLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: David Parrish Operations Supervisor called Safety to report a large Tote setting on the dock floor at door 92 appears to be leaking from the top middle cap on the container. David stated that it appears to be leaking from the cap with a red tag approximately 4oz on the Tote. David stated it looks li ke it may have come from the shipper with the leaking cap.

item.title: Report E-2024030456
item.description:
Report E-2024030456

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-14
  • City: PHOENIXVILLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Pitt Ohio
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Upon arrival at the destination terminal, the drum was discovered to be leaking in the trailer. The drum was immediately placed into an overpack to prevent further release of material. The investigation revealed that the drum had a small puncture hole in the bottom after it made contact with a protruding nail in the trailer floor. The drum is awaiting disposition by the shipper.

item.title: Report E-2024030413
item.description:
Report E-2024030413

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-23
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred inside of a trailer in Greencastle, PA. The spill consists of 6-750ML plastic cartridges of V7206-D Make Up Fluid, which were discovered crushed inside of a box from excessive freight stacked on top of it. The amount spilled could not be quantified.
